channel.title: I can't get my friends to play on my server
channel.description:
I've been coding for a good deal of time and I know what I'm supposed to do. I have the basics down, I have the port 43594 open My No-IP is up The client I gave to my friend has my No-IP in the client.java and GUI.java My client has 127.0.0.1, mine works, his doesn't.
The base is the TeamTorva/Tkoscape
Skype me, ian.lehrer

item.title: I can't get my friends to play on my server
item.dc:creator: @Revitalize Revitalize
item.description:
@Revitalize wrote:

[quote=“IanLehrer, post:1, topic:519098”]I’ve been coding for a good deal of time and I know what I’m supposed to do.
I have the basics down,
I have the port 43594 open
My No-IP is up
The client I gave to my friend has my No-IP in the client.java and GUI.java
My client has 127.0.0.1, mine works, his doesn’t.

The base is the TeamTorva/Tkoscape

Skype me, ian.lehrer[/quote]

127.0.0.1 is your LOCAL IP. For HIS client he needs your no-ip address in the “127.0.0.1” spot in the client.java file

Read full topic
item.source: I can't get my friends to play on my server

item.title: I can't get my friends to play on my server
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

People still use this lol?

You aren’t ported properly and/or have not made exception in your firewall.

Read full topic
